metadata.Title: CVE-2013-2173 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
wp-includes/class-phpass.php in WordPress 3.5.1, when a password-protected post exists, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via a crafted value of a certain wp-postpass cookie.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2173` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 3.8.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
wordpress-l10n - 3.8.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
wordpress-theme-twentyfourteen - 3.8.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
wordpress-theme-twentythirteen - 3.8.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
wordpress-theme-twentytwelve - 3.8.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.8.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1').
